articles.author: Stacy Liberatore
articles.title: Humans settled in North America 17,000 years EARLIER than previously believed, study finds - Daily Mail
articles.description: The bones were found with slaughter marks and fractures that were made by humans 37,000 years ago. Scientists extracted collagen from the bones, allowing them to date the settlement.
articles.content:
Bones of an adult mammoth and her calf have been uncovered at a 37,000-year-old butchering site in New Mexico, which suggest humans settled in North America 17,000 years than previously believed.
